intro: Kinginda tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly kinginda, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Kinginda tomentosa is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
